title: New York Post
aka: New York Post and the Home News

renewed-contributions.title: Wilson, Not Col. House, Was the Master Mind

Col. House Sought Evasion of Party Plank, Says Glass
Col. House's Diary Refutes Bank Act Claim, Says Glass
House Go-Between for Bank Act Foes, Glass Declares
Glass Ascribes Miracle Banning Panic to Wilson
Glass Says Mind of Wilson Rules Whole Bank Act
Reserve Bill Leak to Bankers Laid to House by Glass
Untermyer Aided by House in Weird Bill, Glass Says
Political Sense of Wilson Shown in Bank Bill Jam
Reserve Bill Foes Left Stranded as Bryan Fails Them
Glass Cites Aid of Republicans in Passing Bank Bill
White House Ban Put on Vanderlip, Glass Chronicles
Vanderlip's Plan Riddle in Debate Here, Glass Avers
Plan to Give Bill Wall Street Tag Falls, Glass Says
Glass Declares Reserve Act Vital Aid to Prosperity
Paupers as Heads of Reserve Banks Urged, Glass Says
Sponsors Upheld in Final Bank Bill Vote, Glass Says
Wilson Lauds Aid of Republicans in Signing Bank Act
Glass Finds Rush to Claim Bank Act After its Success
U. S. Reserve Board on Supreme Court Plane, Glass Says
Plan to Cut Total of Reserve Banks Nipped, Glass Says

renewed-contributions.title: Nazi Spies in America
renewed-contributions.note: A 1967 book renewal for this title mentions that it was previously published in the New York Post from December 5, 1938 through January 4, 1939.  A renewal with that date might cover an installment published this day. The installments may have been published under a different title.

comment: We've swept through 1968 renewals.  Resume with 1969.
additional-notes: Published as the New York Evening Post until 1934, when it was renamed the New York Post, its current name. It acquired and eventually absorbed the Bronx Home News in the 1940s.

Note that while some Superman comic strips were renewed with a note specifying that they appeared in the New York Post, there are also renewals for other strips that simultaneously ran in this newspaper and others, filed under other newspapers or syndicates. We do not attempt to include all such renewals here, but only the ones that specifically mention the New York Post.
